wobani.window

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • wobani.window.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Object oriented wrapper class above the native GLFW window.
    See Also:
    GLFW

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Window.MouseShape
      Mouse shape.

                                 java.io.File path,

                                 org.joml.Vector2i click)
        Sets the cursor shape to the specified image.
        Parameters:
        path - image's relative path (with extension like "res/textures/myTexture.png")
        click - the cursor hotspot is specified in pixels, relative to the upper-left corner of the cursor image

      • getFrameSize

        @NotNull
public static org.joml.Vector4i getFrameSize()
        Returns the size of the window's frame. First value is the left, second is the top, third is the right and the fourth is the bottom.
        Returns:
        size of the window's frame

      • setClientAreaSize

        public static void setClientAreaSize(int width,
                                     int height)
        Sets the size of the window's client area to the given values.
        Parameters:
        width - client area's width
        height - client area's height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - width and height must be positive

      • setClientAreaSizeLimits

        public static void setClientAreaSizeLimits(int minWidth,
                                           int minHeight,
                                           int maxWidth,
                                           int maxHeight)
        Sets the size limits of the window's client area to the given values. Max width and max height can't be 0. Max width can't be lower than min width and max height can't be lower than min height. Negative valeues mean don't care.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - minimum width
        minHeight - minimum height
        maxWidth - maximum width
        maxHeight - maximum height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Max width and max height can't be 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Min width can't be lower than max width and min height can't be lower than max height

      • getAspectRatio

        public static float getAspectRatio()
        Return the aspect ratio of the window's client area.
        Returns:
        aspect ratio

      • setAspectRatio

        public static void setAspectRatio(int numerator,
                                  int denominator)
        Sets the required aspect ratio of the client area of the window. If the window is full screen, the aspect ratio only takes effect once it is made windowed. If the window is not resizable, this function does nothing. The aspect ratio is specified as a numerator and a denominator and both values must be greater than zero. For example, the common 16:9 aspect ratio is specified as 16 and 9, respectively. The aspect ratio is applied immediately to a windowed mode window and may cause it to be resized. Negative numbers mean don't care.
        Parameters:
        denominator - denominator
        numerator - numerator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - width and heigh can't be 0

      • getPosition

        @NotNull
public static org.joml.Vector2i getPosition()
        Returns the position, in screen coordinates, of the upper-left corner of the client area of the window.
        Returns:
        position

        Parameters:

      • getId

        public static long getId()
        Returns the glfw window's id. You should use it only if you really don't have other choise.
        Returns:
        window's id

      • swapBuffers

        public static void swapBuffers()
        Swaps the back and the front buffers. You should call it once every frame.

      • pollEvents

        public static void pollEvents()
        Listens for events. You should call it once every frame.

      • isWindowShouldClose

        public static boolean isWindowShouldClose()
        Returns the value of the close flag of the window. If it returns true the window and the application will close unless a WindowEventHandler counteracts.
        Returns:
        the close flag's value

      • setWindowShouldClose

        public static void setWindowShouldClose(boolean close)
        Sets the window's close flag to the given value. If you set it to true the window and the application will close unless a WindowEventHandler counteracts.
        Parameters:
        close - window's close flag

      • isMinimized

        public static boolean isMinimized()
        Determines whether the window is minimized.
        Returns:
        true if the window is minimized, false otherwise

      • isUsable

        public static boolean isUsable()
        Determines wheter the Window is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise

      • release

        public static void release()
        Releases the resources owned by the window. After calling this method, you can't use the window for anything. You should only call this method when the program terminates.
